course.subject: LIFS
course.name: Nature of Life Sciences
course.description: This is an innovative blended-learning course that comprises both independent e-learning and face-to-face tutorial components. The course covers general and up-to-date topics such as conservation biology and animal forms and functions in the field of Biology, metabolism and cell signaling in Biochemistry, and recombinant DNA, animal and plant biotechnology and bioethics in Biotechnology. For students in their first, second and third year of study; or fourth year students with instructor's approval.

reviews.author: SmokingPuddle58
reviews.title: Hard workload, not bad grade, but think twice!
reviews.comment_content:
I will not repeat the content as others have already posted them.

Talking about the quality of the online materials they made..... Very bad.

How come the material still uses .swf document, while Adobe has abandoned Flash in 2021??? And how come some of the link doesn't work at all? The professor should review all online materials before distributing to us.

Also regarding the content, hmm, why they could put these topic together, when they are quite unrelated? After all, I didn't know what I have studied. Maybe I have known that there are many clever people or people who have took biology taking this course to get a good grade and increase their CGA.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Every Monday you are attending a tutorial, but not lecture.(But this tutorial lasts for 1.5 hour, and will not go over the contents in the online material. They will give some new and extra stuff based on the online materials). You yourself are teaching yourself the contents. That's called "blended learning". Therefore, I am rating for "tutors".

Leung: How come you suddenly switch your language during your lesson??? I know that some students also can speak Cantonese, but that's not the reason for you to switch to Cantonese during the lesson. Also, don't force us to answer the question when we don't want to do that! It make us very embarrassing! Anyway, in her lesson, I usually do other things, such as maths and lang assignments, to use time more wisely!

I give no comment to other two "tutors" because they are quite normal, at least they don't force us to answer questions. But all of the tutorials were quite boring.

If you can't adopt such a "blended-learning" style, then run!
reviews.comment_grading:
Quizzes : 20%, on canvas, in which most of the answers can be found on the internet.

Essay    : 20%, usually announced two weeks between study break. 400 word limit. Choose 1 topic among 2.

Final      : 60%, with 40 MCQs. ( 1MCQ == 1.5% of your course grade!!!)

-5% deduction for missing more than 2 tutorials.

Bonus marks will be given for answering questions during tutorial.

I didn't know my marks for LIFS1930 as professors didn't release them..

The grading is not too bad(maybe)! Without any biology background, I eventually get a B+!

Here are some tips for the final exam.🤔

Find some questions related to that topic on the internet and do them. Some of the questions in the final seems to be copied exactly from those online quizzes. (Without even changing the options)

Also, the final will asks the question from the tutorial! (For 2 questions). Remember what professors said during the tutorial!

Finally, some questions may come from the quizzes they set. Revise them briefly before exam.

But the most important is to go through the online materials!(Including the definitions of some key terms!) They will be tested.

Remember that, there are no exclusion for those who have taken biology but the content are mostly high-school biology contents and therefore, think twice before joining this course, especially for those without biology backgrounds.
reviews.comment_workload:
I think quite light for those with biology background. Me, without biology background, find a little "chur" in this course.

As I don't like biology so much, therefore, I put some time in other subjects but not in 1930. Before the final, I feel stressed, so I go through all the materials in a very few hours. That's when I feel "chur". However, the final exam is not difficult. The examination time is 2 hours. But usually the exam can be finished within 1 hour.(As they are all conceptual question)

reviews.comment_content:

reviews.comment_teaching:
Online materials + Zoom lectures
Several readings needed before lessons to get familiar with the topic
Lots of interactions in class, many students pop up their fun ideas
Also, teaching source are separated from online one so u are less likely bored in lectures
Professor in second is quite good. He went through the difficult questions in the quiz with us and clear the concept.
reviews.comment_grading:
IPRS 10%  attend all classes
Online Quiz 30% total 80/90
1000-word essay 60% Not announced
Suprised Grade: A+
Iprs is important if u want a gd grade, u can really stand out by this guaranteed 10 points
Online quiz before class every week, about 10Q, not challenging and time-consuming, most of them can be googled
Essay topics are assigned last week of the semester, every student is given 2 of 12 random topics, 5-6 students per topic set
What topic assigned paly crucial role to your grade, u better choose the topic to show ur creativity and innovativity. If ur essay is dull like your topic is to introduce one species that is rapidly evolving without stating its potential use, I think u will be hard to impress the professor to get a good grade. It is important to show your thoughts. Year 1 without essay writing experience is not recommended to take since the essay really weighs heavily and u may easily screw it up.
reviews.comment_workload:
General speaking, weekly quiz+attendance+1 final assignment+online lecture is not harsh.
This course can save u sometime in the mid-term period, the final exam period everyone is busy, Final essay has a two-week quota that makes u feel less stressed.

reviews.author: Jungkok
reviews.title: Poor grading course, not worth to take unless you want a low GPA
reviews.comment_content:
Most of the content is somehow extended from the course LIFS 1902 or DSE Biology syllabus, it would be easy to understand the content if you have a Biology background.
However, under COVID-19, there is no final examination in this course, and each student is only assigned one essay topic related to one topic taught only, so it is not a must for students to go through all of the topics.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching of the three instructors is fair, and the content is easily understandable.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very poor grading.
The competition in this course during this semester is very tight. Since it has no final exam this semester, there is a final assignment essay that contributed to 70% of the course grade. The mark of the essay is not transparent, I could not see my result even when I have sent an email for appealing my grade. And the grading for essay writing is somehow quite subjective, since different topics are graded by different instructors.
I have got a "C" in the final grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite light workload. We only have to finish some quizzes every week before the lecture and can easily get the 30% score. Most answers to the quizzes can be searched on Google.
And there is one essay that replaced the final exam, contributed 70% of the course grade.

This course is using blended learning approach. Which mean it require you to learn on your own. You need to read the reading material before you go to the tutorial class. You need to get familiar with the topic. The tutorial is just point out some main ideas that you need to know.
Dr Lam is good. He is passionate in teaching and he want to interact with students. He encourage students to participate in the discussions and welcome us to express our ideas or opinions in the related topics. However, he only teach three tutorials.
reviews.comment_grading:
Original:
Weekly online quiz 20%
Written assignment (400words) 20% at the end of semester
Final examination (MCQ) 60%
(5% deduction may be made if more than 2 no-show)

Adjusted (due to class cancellation):
Weekly online quiz 30%
Written assignment (900words) 70%

My grade
Weekly online quiz ~about 7.89/10
Written assignment ~unknown but I think I wrote like shit

Final grade=C+
reviews.comment_workload:
light.
Weekly online quiz (MCQ about 9 to 10), not so difficult but need to pay attention in doing the quiz. These quiz cannot using google only, you need to refer to some of the reading material provided. (If you want to get full marks)

In conclusion, for people who don't enjoy study biology, you should not choose this course, otherwise you will become me.

reviews.author: Constance_V

Includes conservation biology, the forms and functions of animals, metabolism and cell signaling, recombinant DNA, animal and plant biotechnology, and bioethics.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I took this course via zoom, it was a tutorial course and used case analysis to explain the contexts.

The three professors were ok,  while I think LEUNG is slightly better.
reviews.comment_grading:
Due to the pandemic, the final exam was canceled and we only needed to write an essay of fewer than 1000 words. The topic must be chosen in two arranged ones.

I wrote about 700 words and finally got A-, don't know how it works.

BTW my major is in LIFS, maybe it is easier for me?

reviews.author: Markus:)
reviews.title: Nice course of Non-bio Students
reviews.comment_content:
Simple Biology& Ecology topics. If you did SL Bio in the IB, this wouldn't be a problem for you, as the majority of the topics are just revisions with a bit of HL content sprinkled in there such as the Krebs Cycle and Glycolysis.

Topics
1. Evolution
2. Ecology
3. Conservation Biology
4. Animal Form & Function
5. Cell Signaling
6. Metabolism & Nutrition
7. Transcription and Translation
8. Stem Cells
9. Recombinant DNA
10. Animal Biotechnology
11. Plant Biotechnology
12. Bio-ethics and Public Acceptance
reviews.comment_teaching: The entire teaching team was very approachable & were very kind. My favorite instructors were Philip Lam &Melody Leung, both of them would respond to emails fairly fast and generally made the content more interesting than it was. I remember that Prof Lam included a comparison between the components of Energy drinks such as Monster and Redbull and compared them to Coffee & Tea. It was a good way to link the content to actual applications.
reviews.comment_grading:
Scheme

IPRS Quizzes = 20%
In Class Particiation = 20%
Written Assignment = 60%

I got a B+ in the end which I'm fine with. I think that the majority got full marks for their IPRS and the in-class participation. As such the course grade is basically dependent on how you do on the Essay.
reviews.comment_workload:
Note-taking can take a fair bit of time depending on the module as some take 2/3 hours while most take an hour. I remember that Animal Form and Function, Cell Signaling, and Metabolism & Nutrition took longer than most.

Both the IPRS and Class participation are free marks. Just pay attention during class to catch the IPRS and answer the prof's questions. Who could have known that Profs are more inclined to help a student outside of class hours if they participate during class.

The bulk of the grade was made up of a 1000 Word Essay where you were you could choose between one of two open-ended questions. We didn't have a final exam due to the sem being online. The Essay is really a hit or miss as they don't really give you a lot of guidance. Just email the prof if you are uncertain as it makes up the majority of your grade.

reviews.author: IssacLai
reviews.title: They might be just some small drawbacks, yet they happen at the right place which makes them a sugar-coated trap
reviews.comment_content: The contents are more or less the same every semester. If you did study some biology before, the materials are not too hard for you to read and understand while enough to raise some interest into the topic. Also doing a bit research may help on doing case studies in tutorials as well as selecting essay topics and writing them.
reviews.comment_teaching: They are able to guide you in class and provide equal chance for all to get bonus marks.
reviews.comment_grading:
20% quizzes to be done every week at home online without time limit. This is easy and not time consuming.

60% final exam with 40 mcs. This depends on your understanding of the content. If you have enough studying then 90 minutes are much more than enough to complete. Just note that a few questions are based on what is said during tutorial but not the contents on canvas. Also bioethics will also be in the exam.

The 20% essay is the real deal. I bet this is where grades are determined actually as the above 80% are just too easy to get high score. A difference in two or three marks here may cause a difference in grade, I suppose.

Although I get nearly 90% in the quizzes, obtain a handful(at least a bit above average?) of bonus marks, and performing really well in exam, eventually I got a B+ only. I guess my essay ruined the whole thing...although I don't know why. The course does not let you know your essay marks as well as the final exam, so I have no idea what went wrong. I won't appeal though, because this should probably be the only lifs course i am taking, so I would rather work harder on the subjects i am interested in.

Well, in another perspective, this means that those without a biology background can also strike for an A range in the course just like those who have, and I really have this kind of friend (we are both in year 1) who ended up an A+. This is the only reason I gave it a D but not an E.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not high.
The time required to read the course material is at most several hours per topic, and if you omit the videoes it takes probably less than an hour. I don't recommend this though because they are worth watching. For the quizzes, you can safely refer to the internet, although careful reading the course material once is enough to get you a nine out of ten, the remaining mark depends on how careful you read the question. Tutorials are in a light mood and you can choose to attend but daydreaming,  but the questions are not hard and many of them has no fixed answer, so try to raise your hand a bit occasionally.
If not the essay this part would be an A --- yes now I really hate that 400 word essay after grades are out.

reviews.comment_teaching:
Blended Learning Mode is used in this course. Students are required to read most of the materials before the class.

Students are divided into groups and encouraged to discuss during the lesson. The instructors will give you examples and case studies to talk about in each lesson.  

I like Dr Lam most. We can see his passion in the class. He always sends students an email after the lesson to recap what we have discussed or learnt. He also explained the answers of the online quiz in each lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading scheme changes because of the cancellation of the classes.

Original grading scheme:
Weekly online quiz - 20%
Essay (400 words) - 20%
Final examination (MCQ) - 60%

New grading scheme:
Weekly online quiz - 30%
Essay (max: 900 words) - 70%

Bonus marks will be given after answering the questions during the lessons.  

You cannot know your essay's score. It is difficult to judge the grading is reasonable or not only with the online quizzes' mark.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light workload. Only a weekly online quiz (with no time limit) and 1 essay are required.

For the weekly quiz, there are about 9 MCQs with no time limit in each quiz. You can search for most of the answers on Google. Thus, the mean of online MCQs is usually high.

For the essay, you can choose 1 out of the 2 assigned topics to write. The examples discussed in class (which may not appear in notes but only appear in the reading materials) cannot be used in the essay. Therefore, you may need to remember what you have discussed in class because of the topic's requirement.

reviews.author: TM-AN
reviews.title: Not a course for Year 1 students
reviews.comment_content:
The course materials consist of 12 chapters. Chapter 1 is about evolution. Chapter 2-3 are about ecology and biodiversity. Chapter 4-6 are about cell biology. Chapter 7-12 gives an introduction to genetics.

The materials are not easy to understand mainly because the length of different parts in a chapter is not properly assigned.

It is common to see that the notes just defined a term then move on to the next part, while you don't really know why you need to know that term.

The notes for Ch. 4-6 is very lengthy, having paragraphs for every point, but the notes for Ch. 7-12 is too brief, far from sufficient to understand a concept. I mostly rely on the notes I made during my DSE period to deal with these chapters.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Only one 80-min. tutorial every week, no lectures.

The lecturers will assume you already know everything about the chapter before the tutorial, which is usually about a case-study.

The lecturers do take attendances, so you still have to attend the tutorials even if the contents mostly do not appear in the exam.
reviews.comment_grading:
The exam (60%) is a 40-question MC, 1.5 hr is given to finish it.
The MC are also very easy, in the sense that if you memorized everything in the materials.

If you did memorize the definitions of all the relevant terms, you will definitely know the answers, and you will definitely not know the answer if you did not memorize all of the relevant terms.

So here comes the problem. this course is not specifically designed for year 1 students, I found quite a lot of higher year students, even year 4 students studying in this course.

With a very easy exam, the higher year students are likely to get near full marks in the course.

Year 1 student will struggle really hard to get satisfying grade in this course.

Note: You will not know your marks of your essay and your final exam.
reviews.comment_workload: Basically no workload, only 9-10 MC on canva every week (20%). An essay (20%) is assigned near the end of the semester, with the deadline the end of study period.

reviews.comment_teaching:
Jessica's Part:

reviews.comment_grading:

No marks released for both essay and exam.
Final grade: A

- a typical instructor, nothing special, she will ask you question and if no one answer she will give the mic to anyone nearby

Melody(Leung Kar Wah)
she teaches:
1.Stem Cells
2.Plant Biotechnology
3.Bio-ethics and Public Acceptance

- compare to other instructor, her teaching method is very different. she will give us a topic and allow to discuss within group for the whole lesson. and she will come to your group and ask you what you think (don't be nervous, she will guide you and there is no  right or wrong answer to her question)
- you will automatically gain a bonus mark if you are not totally silent
reviews.comment_grading:
20% canvas quiz
20% 400 words essay
60% final exam
+ bonus mark for participating in class

2 no-show will result in mark penalty  (remember to sign the attendance sheet)

for the essay:
you need to express your view or explain things in 400 words, which is quite hard.

for the exam: (1.5 h)
quite easy
consists of 40 questions

for Jessica's and melody's part:
not too difficult if you read through the material for a couple of times

for Philip's part:
don't waste time remember the pathway of a certain reaction (e.g kreb cycle/ how many ATP produced) this will NOT appear in the exam
read his email about the exam tip ! really helpful

for Helen part :
idk, she asked some questions that does not appear in the material provided (or i didnt revise (?))

i actually didn't spend too much time (~1.5 days) on this course's exam cause i have other exam on the same day. but i still know how to answer 80% of the exam questions and eventually got a B+. i would say is satisfactory.

they wont release the mark for the essay and exam, the grade is satisfactory but not transparent
reviews.comment_workload:
no midterm
1.5h of lesson per week (yes its true)
you only need to do the weekly online quiz ( you can finish it within 30 mins)
this is a 3 credit course but it feels like a 1 credit course for me

reviews.author: stark_elijah
reviews.comment_content:
Syllabus
Biodiversity and Evolution
Ecology
Conservation Biology
Animal Form and Function
Cell Signaling  
Metabolism and Nutrition
Transcription and Translation
Stem Cell (Harder)
Recombinant DNA
Animal Biotechnology
Plant Biotechnology
Bio-ethics and Public Acceptance

Components
Online quiz 20%
Written assignment 20%
Final examination 60%
reviews.comment_teaching: It is a combination of lecture and classroom teaching. Some instructors will have more interactions with you but some will only give boring talking. Sometimes, they will have role play and discussion. I like discussion because you can speak with your group mates and "Hea".
reviews.comment_grading: Quite good. If you have studied fall semester 1902 or you are year 2-4 that study life science, you must have advantage. Have a normal performance can get B range.
reviews.comment_workload: Every week has 1 online quiz. It is quite easy if you have read all the online material. Actually, some answers can be searched from the internet.

reviews.author: pyliab
reviews.title: Review
reviews.comment_content:
Most of the content are overlapped with LIFS1902
But they are quite simple
Recommend this course to those who also study LIFS1902
But you can only absent 2 class
reviews.comment_teaching:
The course mainly relies on your own online study and some of the details in class
Philip is very good
But the others..........I can only say they prepared well, and thanks for making science more boring:)
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite good grade
I forget to do some of the homework still get A
But some of the additional information taught in class are also included in the final exam
Remember to go to the class
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is quite reasonable.
Homework: About ten MC online questions every week
No mid-term, which is a very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very good reason why I recommend this course to you all
One essay
Final is MC questions

reviews.author: qwerty
reviews.title: Rleaxing but informative
reviews.comment_content:
Tutorial (1.5hrs) and weekly canvas quizzes (10 min of ur time, 10 questions usually)
Quiz to be submitted a day b4 ur tutorial session

Jessica: ecology, evolution amd conservation biology. Not too difficult. Good instructor
Philip: animal form and fx, cell signalling, nutrition
Helen: animal biotech,  genetic engineering, genetics
Melody: plant biotech, stem cells, bioethics
reviews.comment_teaching:
Jessica explains succinctly and keeps the course interesting. Willing to answer questions
Philip likes to include stuff outside the reading materials in his tutorial sessions. Very nice instructor and very informative. Looooong reading material
Helen's part is quite simple but she makes it more complex than it shd be in the reading materials. Still a good instructor and will answer many questions in great detail. Light reading material. Her quiz questions co me from some online website accessible by students, but the questions are not always relevant to her reading materials
Melody oversimplifies her part, in my opinion. Her tutorial has students discussing amongst themselves without giving much directions to students, so it results in awkward discussions at times. Reading materials can be a bit confusing
reviews.comment_grading:
Online quiz (mc) (only counts after add/drop period)
400 word essay (choose 1 out of 2 given topics to write on; topics released 2ish weeks b4 final. To be submitted a few days b4 final) (both hardcopy and aoftcopy have to be submitted)
MC final (1.5 hrs) (40ish questions)
Attendance (only counts after add/drop period)
These all count towards ur grade

Dunno the marks obtained for final or the essay
No paper checking
From what ive heard, not hard to get b
Personally not too satisfied with grade (a)
reviews.comment_workload:
Lesson is relaxing
Mostly the tutor talking
They try to engage u and have students discuss amongst themselves but most ppl keep to themselves and it's dead air most of the time
Most ppl dont pay attention
Despite their rule on counting students as no-show if they are 15 minutes late, they are still very lax abt it. They let ppl who come in 30 min late to sign in.
Quizes are easy, reading comprehension really
Final is trickier
Essay is rlly hard to pull off since the word limit is 400. Exceedingly difficult to explain those topics succinctly without oversimplifying the matter

reviews.author: kkhunter
reviews.title: Well...
reviews.comment_content:
Basic biology and biotechnology

Intended Learning Outcomes

At the end of this course, students will be able:

To acquire fundamental knowledge through computer-assisted learning in the areas of biochemistry, biology and biotechnology.
To cultivate self-paced practice, feedback and monitoring of self-progress.
To be able to inaugurate global connection.
To be able to utilize in-class game-based / case study activities to reinforce online learning.
To develop higher order skills in order to make critical and rational judgments over societal concerns in life sciences.
To seek and share biological knowledge, independently and in collaboration with others.
reviews.comment_teaching: The tutor will repeat the online material and have some discussion.
reviews.comment_grading:
I didn't revise much
DSE BIO: 4
Grade: B
reviews.comment_workload:
Low
Remember to do the online quiz every week.
Components

Percentage
Online quiz                            20
Written assignment *             20
Final examination 1.5 hours  60

5% Deduction will be made if more than 2 no- shows in class after add/drop

reviews.author: Patrickkkk
reviews.comment_content:
It is a relaxing course.
You just need to memorise all of the self learning things by yourself.
Some online quiz questions can bo found on google.
Those teaching does not help a lot.
Answering questions on lessons will get bonus marks but it doesn’t help a lot.
reviews.comment_teaching:
They said 50% is taught in lesson.
The other 50% is self learning.
But it is 100% self learning for the final examination.
Those teaching is useless but it may be useful for deciding the topic of the essay.
reviews.comment_grading:
You cannot know your scores of both essay and final exam.
The statistics of the score of online quiz, essay, and final exam also will not be released.
No paper checking.
reviews.comment_workload:
One 1.5 hours lesson per week.
Need to take attendance and you cannot skip more than two lessons.
One online quiz per week with 10 mc questions.
One essay about the topic they taught with not more than 300 words.
The topic will be assigned and released at the end of the semester.
The essay need to be submitted at the end of study break.
One 2 hours final exam with 40~45 mc questions.

reviews.author: 騫
reviews.title: Good grade and similar to Lifs1902
reviews.comment_content: TOPIC大部分同1902相似，每堂上堂之前都要睇曬canvas d notes 同做埋online quiz，利申有bio底一定無問題。
reviews.comment_teaching: 上堂主要要求學生討論，不過其實有好多人都唔出聲。仲會要學生答問題，只要答到就有bonus marks，上堂氣氛我覺得好過其他courses。
reviews.comment_grading: 好grade。不過final 同  essay 無得睇翻grade。
reviews.comment_workload:
每星期得一堂
online quiz x 12
assignment x1 (400字 essay, 可以起佢隨機抽比你嘅題目揀一條做)
Final （MC）

reviews.author: Mandyho
reviews.title: LIFS1930
reviews.comment_content: Just basic biology stuff and most topics are easy to follow. For LIFS1902 people or high school biology students, it will be a simple revision.
reviews.comment_teaching: No lecture. Only some briefing followed by group discussion. Some instructor did create a good discussion atmosphere while most not.
reviews.comment_grading: Easy to score A range if you can get the regular quiz web work correft and do  satisfactorily for a short written assignment. Final is easy if you go through the material once before the final.
reviews.comment_workload: Depends if you read the weekly material regularly. Have weekly web work with only 10 questions each and a short written assignment to be done during study break.

reviews.author: Alpha703
reviews.title: Unclear but good grading
reviews.comment_content:
Tang:
Biodiversity and Evolution
Ecology
Conservation Biology
Lam:
Animal Form and Function
Cell Signaling
Metabolism and Nutrition
Cheung:
Transcription and Translation
Stem Cells
Animal Biotechnology
Leung:
Recombinant DNA
Plant Biotechnology
Bio-ethics and Public Acceptance

Topics are broad but not in-depth. I think it is simliar to HKALE Biology(not so sure since I study HKDSE Bio but most topics are more in-depth than DSE). Don't need to put too much efforts on the biochemical reactions in the contents(the complex protein names...)

Blended learning: You read all the reading materials on canvas(similar to textbook/lecture notes in regular courses, have some Flash/videos), as well as the tutorial materials(the basis of tutorial activities, though most of us read them right in the tutorial sessions). Then just go to the tutorials and take attendance and learn and also get bonus marks for answering questions. In the tutorials you sit in pre-assigned groups and usually there will be group discussions. Good chance to meet some friends too.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Tang: Generally ok. (already forgot her teaching since she's in the first 3 lessons)
Lam: Passionate and tried hard to get us to actively answer questions and show our understanding by not using the wordings in the materials to explain the answers. Tutorial materials are well-prepared.
Cheung: She can explain concepts clearly and used whiteboards to ensure that our concepts are accurate. Not very interactive though. Tutorial materials are ok.
Leung: Very relaxing teaching(lol). Just go over some main points then let us 'group discussion' in the rest of the lesson. If she is not nearby, then our group will just chat on whatever topics as if it's break time. She will come over every group to facilitate meaningful discussion on the tutorial questions(and did a good job since we really learn more after the discussions)
reviews.comment_grading:
Unclear but good grading.

Assignments('Quizs' to be completed before tutorial day)(20%) Me: 86/89  Mean:~81.5/89
Essay(20%) Me: Unknown
Final Exam(60%) Me: 31/40(Estimated, they never release the results)
Bonus mark(Get them by raise hands and answer questions in tutorials except Leung's)(+?%) Me: 4/7 (Answered questions in 4 out of 7 tutorials that can add bonus marks)

Grade: A-
(Note: I didn't study LIFS 1902)
reviews.comment_workload:
Assignments: The 'quizs' on canvas that your need to complete before the tutorial session, 10 straightforward MCs based on the reading materials but can be Googled. Usually need to spend 0.5-2 hours to finish, much lighter than Webwork/masteringphysics.

Essay: Released in the 2nd last week for the semester and deadline is the last day of study break(before final exam). 2 topics are randomly assigned to you and you need to choose one to write not more than 400 words essay. Due to the word limit(exceeding it will result in marks deduction) the things you can write is limited so not big workload.

Final exam: I spent 1 day to study only and only covered half of the contents. But if you sped 2 days you will revise all the topics.

reviews.author: Rezzaldo
reviews.comment_content:
Covers DSE Bio topics
like biodiversity, ecology, animal form and structures, animal & plant biotechnology, ethics, etc.
Due to its diversity and time constraint, tutors won't explore deeply into each topic.
Mostly DSE-level, yet there are some new terms that haven't been mentioned during high school years.
Reading the materials is suffice for finals.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Jessica: She is very nice and has a soft voice. Encourages students to take part in discussions.

Lam: He likes students to explain a bit further. Don't need to use jargons, but you should be able to explain the concepts precisely.

Helen: Shows most professionalism because she looks the most serious(?) Similar to Lam.

Melody: Uses most of the time to help out students to brainstorm ideas for her essays. If you are ever assigned to hers, then you're in good hands, else it's justing wasting your time to attend.
reviews.comment_grading:
More than 2 absence leads to mark penalty.
A bonus mark for an acceptable answer in each tutorial.
The average for every quiz is very high, but it is easy to obtain full marks if you revise well. No time limit, so check your answers carefully before submitting unless you want to challenge yourself.
reviews.comment_workload:
One online quiz due before each tutorial. Won't be graded for quizzes during the add-drop period and those past deadlines.
A 400-word essay is due days before the start of exam period. You can choose 1 from 2 assigned topics. The late penalty is harsh. A penalty also recurs if you exceed the word limit.
No midterm.
Only finals.

reviews.author: Adidas
reviews.title: Easy but not fair course
reviews.comment_content: Super easy. Read all ppt and tutor notes are enough. Not much need to be understood.
reviews.comment_teaching: Some are good. Some are boring and students are quite inactive usually.
reviews.comment_grading: Good.
reviews.comment_workload: Okay. Remember to do quiz every week. BUT the essay topic allocation is super unfair. Some students were being allocated by very easy topics, just a few clicks on the internet can find tons of information and references while some topics are difficult to find enough information to write about and the content of the topics sounds easy but in fact acquired deep understanding of difficult knowledges and essay reading skills. It may cause problems for non-lifs major or students with weak english.

reviews.author: amazing
reviews.comment_content: The content is not difficult. If you have studied other life science courses before , you can even skip revising some chapters.All tutorials. They takes attendance and you can get bonus marks by answering questions in classes.
reviews.comment_teaching: Philip is good. You can learn biology that is not for exam on lessons. But I remembered there was a instructor that didn't come at all because of sick leave. But that won't affect so much because the exam mainly based on the notes on canvas but not the content on tutorials.
reviews.comment_grading: I just studied 1 day and got B range. All mc questions in exam. But I cannot view my score of the essay.
reviews.comment_workload: Every week there are quizzes but they are easy. 1 essay with 500 words only and final exam of mc questions only. Not much recitation is required.

reviews.author: Sarah Feng
reviews.comment_content: As a non-bio major year one student who studied DSE biology, the contents are still mostly easy. The more difficult part for me is about transcription and translation.
reviews.comment_teaching: Since this is a blended learning course, tutorials are mostly for exchanging ideas but not teaching. Students are required to learn the given online material by themselves.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade is not as good as I thought. The grading is not transparent at all. No paper checking is available. I am able to know my marks only after 2 times of request.
reviews.comment_workload: The Workload is quite flexible. It is easy to finish the online quizzes. But learning all the material definitely takes time. Even though the instructors claimed that memorizing information is not encouraged, the exam questions really test memory but not logics.

reviews.author: wasd0109
reviews.title: Extreme difficulty for non-bio students.
reviews.comment_content: It covers introductory part of some advanced courses such as cell bio, biochem and etc. Since I have taken 2040 and some other more advance LIFS courses before, the content is easy to handle for me. However, this will be tremendously difficult for ppl who have limited  knowledge to biology so please don't take it to fulfill Sci school requirement if u give a damn about your grade.
reviews.comment_teaching: Due to the nature of the course (Blended learning), I rarely attend the tutorial which student exchange idea. Thus I cant give a very clear insight into the instructors' teaching quality. But in the few tutorial that I attended, I think Dr. Lam's tutorial is really fun and engaging. I can feel his passion in teaching and he would send message to support us and encourage us to ask question.
reviews.comment_grading: The online quizzes are relatively easy and the final exam is of MC. The end term essay is a bit tough as some of the topics are not directly related to the content of the course but ask for a bit of a brainstorming but overall B range should be easy if you complete all the tasks on time. Bonus marks for attending the tutorial classes but not really that important.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload divided by weeks, very difficult for non-bio students.

reviews.author: ceciliaTWK
reviews.comment_content:
有D TOPIC同1902重複，但系教既野散收收。
每個星期系CANVAS會有一大堆野比你睇完之後做ONLINE QUIZ，基本上都算系簡單，有時可以上網搵到答案。
reviews.comment_teaching: 上堂基本上都系比D問題討論下，上下網搵答案，基本上就系對著部電腦上堂，有D悶。
reviews.comment_workload:
online quiz x 12 (一星期一份）
assignment x1 (400字 assay)
Final 全MC

reviews.author: httang
reviews.comment_content: Mostly overlapped with LIFS 1902. The notes are quite detailed and long. Topics are about biotechnology, cells and biodiversity.
reviews.comment_teaching: So many discussion during lessons but still it is a bit boring. Attendence is not counted.
reviews.comment_grading: Memorize and understand all the notes and you will get a good grade. But it takes time to read through all the notes you got .
reviews.comment_workload: Have an essay to be handed in at the end of the course, which the questions are easy to answer. There are weekly online quizzes. They wont take you much time to complete them.

reviews.author: dliak
reviews.title: Simple work, good grading
reviews.comment_content: The content of this course is much overlapped with LIFS 1902. There are too many simple and broad concepts invovled in the tutoral material. But it really takes time to memorize, but the exam is really simple, makes you doubt about what you have learned.
reviews.comment_teaching: Lecturers for this course are mostly energetic, except Helen, who seems to be absent in teaching and not prepared.Because the teaching is based on group discussion and case study, they may have tried to motivate students to participate, but the results are always awkwardness and silence.This in part is the students' responsibility, of course.
reviews.comment_grading:
Online Quiz takes up 20%, more than 100 questions in total. Interestingly, the questions are sometimes inconsistent with the online materials. For Jessica classes especially, there are videos about ecosystems, but the questions are too specific  to the video content.
Essay takes up 20%, about 400 words, with topics on one tutorial. It's easy as long as you have attended that tutorial and read the materials(although not neccessarily)
Final exam takes up 60%. However, there are only 45 MC questions out of my expectations. That makes me nervous as well, as if you make mistakes for 1 question, there shall be great change to your grade.
But generally speaking, as far as I know, the grading is farily nice. Although the essay grades and final exam scores are not released at last, many get a satisfactory grade.
reviews.comment_workload: If you don't expect it to be hard, then the workload is not an issue. No attendence in tutorial which is once a week, no lectures. If you manage to memorize all these stuff inside the online materials, of course, the workload will be comparable to LIFS 1902. But no use in the final exam, which mostly depends on your common knowledge.

reviews.author: PeanutBoy
reviews.title: a course that gives you no stress
reviews.comment_content:
Divided into modules, most of these are simple biology stuff that you probably have learnt in high school. Just a bit of new knowledge that can be handled pretty easily.

- Evolution
- Ecology
- Conservation
- Animal form and function (types of tissue)
- Cell signaling
- Metabolism and nutrition
- DNA Transcription and translation
- Stem cells
- Recombinant DNA
- Biotech
- Ethnics
reviews.comment_teaching: To be honest, the tutorials are pretty much useless. They seem like those meaningless LANG courses where you do group discussion most of the time. I usually do my own stuff or chat with my groupmates. You can actually learn it all from the canvas materials yourselves without giving a sh*t about the lessons. Yet, I find the materials to be a mess sometimes, so it might be better to make your own notes from the materials given.
reviews.comment_grading:
20% - 12 canvas quiz
(MCs with supplementary materials to help you)
60% - final exam
(MCs again which are easy if you really read thru the notes put on canvas. Just read and think carefully before making a choice)
20% - 400-word essay
(I hate the fact that they release details of the essay task just before study break and require you to submit it right before your finals)
reviews.comment_workload: Another stress-free course. Just submit your canvas quiz and essay punctually. But again, you have to finish your essay during the study break, making the task quite an annoyance.

reviews.author: USTBCB
reviews.title: A good grade course for year 1 Sci student to study
reviews.comment_content:
Each topic will not go very deep, just the simple thing . Each week just have to attend 1.5hrs lecture.

These topics are taught by Jessica
Week 1: Evolution
Week 2: Ecology
Week 3: Conservation Biology

These topics are taught by Dr. Phillip Yeung
Week 4: Animal Forms and Function
Week 5: Cell Signaling
Week 6: Metabolism and Nutrition

These topics are taught by Melody Leung
Week 7: Transcription and Translation
Week 8: Stem Cell
Week 9: Recombinant DNA
Week 10: Animal Biotechnology
Week 11: Plant Biotechnology
Week 12: Bioethics
reviews.comment_teaching: Honestly, all professors taught very well, they can create a good learning environment in the class all the times. They all encourage student to answer the questions in class in order to gain bonus marks towards the final grade.
reviews.comment_grading:
Due to the suspension of class, the grading system was changed in this semester.

Original grading system
12 Quizes: 20%
400 Words Essay: 20%
Final Exam : 60%

This semester grading system
12 Quizes: 30%
900 Words Essay: 70%

Each quiz I nearly got full marks, but the essay marks are not given.

Finally, I got a A-
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not too heavy compare to MATH 1012/1013, you just have to do online quiz before attending the lecture. Each quiz only have 10 questions, and all of the answers can be found in the notes. The essay are not too difficult for a year 1 student, every student will have two sets of essay topic which they can choose the one they are interested in it. The essay is a little bit time-consuming as most of the essay topic have to use example to explain but not allowed to use the example provided in notes. This causes a little bit time-consuming.

reviews.author: iwantarange
reviews.title: A quite good course with low workload
reviews.comment_content:
This course has 4 main topics:
Tang: Evolution and conservation biology (the topic is not very interesting if you are not interested in environmental science)
Lam: Processes inside organisms, including cell signaling, respiratory system, food and nutrition, etc. (not bad, some content overlaps with HKDSE biology)
Cheung and Leung focus more on biotechnology and ethics.

In conclusion this course covers various aspects of life science, which matches with the course name.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Tang: Not good not bad
Lam: He teaches quite well. Has tried to explain concepts clearly and has maintained a good learning environment.
Cheung: Her teaching is ok, but somehow I don't think many people likes the way she teach for unknown reason.
Leung: Encourages discussion among groups. She will spend some time on each group to let your discussions more informative.
reviews.comment_grading:
20% Quizzes
20% Written Assignment
60% Final (all MC questions)
Some bonus for participating in class
No midterm, only quizzes score are known

Statistics:
Quizzes: Mean 81.1/89 Me 87/89
Written Assignment: A normal one like everyone else
Final: I think I get about 30/40 while the exam is not very hard
Bonus: I think I reached the maximum because I answered exactly 1 question for most of the tutorials
Grade: A-

Try to revise the self-learning materials (the pdf for quizzes) carefully and I don't think you will get a bad grade. Some questions are based on subtle parts in the self-learning materials, which determines your grade a lot in my opinion.
reviews.comment_workload:
Just 1.5 hours of tutorial per week and do the quizzes before lesson. You can look for answer of Cheung's quizzes via Google (somehow I usually can't find answer to quizzes in self-learning materials), not sure about Tang's ones. Lam's and Leung's quizzes require a good understanding of the self-learning materials, but you can find nearly all answers in the materials.

In general, I don't think the workload is high. Even the written assignment requires 400 words only. You may further reduce your workload if you have a solid background in life science.
(For me, I am year 1 with non-LIFS intended major. I have studied HKDSE biology but didn't study LIFS1902. You can be non-attentive during class and study 2~3 days before final exam if you have similar/better LIFS background as mine.)

reviews.author: just a guy
reviews.title: a very good graded course
reviews.comment_content: 教嘅同LIFS1902差唔多但係易好多 都有少少新野 中學有讀過bio/上過LIFS1902就會覺得呢科好輕鬆 有biodiveristy, ecology, animal form, cell signaling, plant bio, recombinant DNA, Bio ethics etc.
reviews.comment_teaching:
4個professor輪住教唔同topics
jessica主要教biodiveristy, ecology
philip lam主要教animal form同signaling
melody主要教stem cell, plant bio, bio-ethics
helen 主要教translation transcription, animal biotech
除咗helen, 其他professors都幾好
reviews.comment_grading:
好好好好好好好好好好好好好好好好好好grade
好易拎A range

Percentage
Online quiz :20%
Written assignment :20%
Final examination :60% (全mc)
reviews.comment_workload: 冇乜workload 係每教新topic都要做一次online quiz, 好簡單單,答案上網/notes都搵到. 考final前作篇幾百字essay，題目佢隨機派俾你

reviews.author: myosin
reviews.title: Very BAD GRADE course
reviews.comment_content: Simpler than lifs1902!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is very relaxing in the lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
What I want to say about this course is that the grade is super bad! You won't know your score of your quiz and essay.
Getting a full mark online quiz should be a gift and it is supposed that you should get full mark for that.
You will also get some bonus mark if you answer questions in the lesson.
But the problem is that you won't know your score before releasing your grade. You will NEVER know why you get super bad grade. Although I think it is a easy course, with most of the questions in the quiz I know how to answer, it turns out that I got a B- only. What is the problem behind?
My confidence originates from the results of lifs1902, since I got A- from that. And this course is even  a lot easier and simpler than lifs1902. But why I would get just a B- in lifs1930!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Lifs1930 is supposed to let some students with no prior biology background to study, so the concepts should be simpler. But the grade is really disastrous.
Not as good as others thought.
Hate this subject with no release of result!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.comment_workload: Almost no workload that you will not put focus in this subject. But consequently it turns out to be a great disaster. So be conscious to study regularly and not the last minute.

reviews.author: smyuen
reviews.title: Great Course
reviews.comment_content:
High school level bio stuff.

(What is wrong with this review system? Why bother to make it a so-called 'adequate' length?)
